Reviews.Title: “A comfortable accommodation !!!”
Reviews.Author: Anand_ks
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip to Berlin with my colleagues and we took their apartment block just opposite to their Hotel block. My first impression to this hotel was nice simple and convenience. The sleep quality was nice. I used to have only my breakfast from the hotel which was really nice for me. The staff's were also nice. The location was also good near to the S - Bahn station. Also a shopping area is near by "Karl-Marx-Straße". There is a shopping mall with media markt in that mall you will find an Indian Restaurant. The food was really nice and economical. Some suggestions from my side to the Hotel will be; Providing at least 1 ltr. of drinking water to every room/ person at free of charge, Some English TV Channels in the room - what we had was only the BBC & CNN - no entertainment !!! When we checked for an extra power adapter to our room, we were called to the reception... this i didn't felt nice. may be because of the lack of staff's or by the policy. But the guest has to be served to satisfy their needs. No one guided us to our rooms, But the overall experience was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and not far from airport”
Reviews.Author: axel7_11
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there with a friend, who booked it because it was four star, and low price, well it is nice hotel, clean and friendly . Very good breakfast. Unfortunately very expensive internet . Also only a short bus ride to and from Schoenefeld Airport, with bus stop located less than a hundred yards from the hotel ! Subway is a bit longer walk away, especially during cold winter.

Reviews.Title: “Good Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: kprkn
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a short metro ride away from the centre. Nice, clean big rooms. Good bar, staff not particularly warm but helpful. A few restaurants surround the hotel but they are not recommended, best to eat in Berlin before you come back to the hotel or its the 24 hour garage. Overall good experience and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sameerpa79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and it was value for money compared to what you could pay for a hotel in Berlin. However it was very noisy and our room didn't have air con we had to leave the windows open. In saying that the hotel was very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money - unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Grzeg
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for small money. We have been travelled with two kids and hotel agreed to two extra beds within standard rate. To accommodate that we have been given huge corner room with the windows on two walls of the room. Great stuff! Pretty well located - 5-7 minutes walk to the U-bahn Station Grenzalle. Very clean althought one can see this is not a new hotel. Downsides: no coffee corner, wifi chargeable, pretty noisy street adjacent to the hotel. However if you get good price - go there!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daft-duck50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park hotel blub for 6 nights in April. Got a great rate on hotels.com. the rooms are large spacious clean and the beds comfortable, they have a mini bar with room for bottled water i bought at the local supermarket All staff were helpful and friendly the reception staff always took time to give me directions and show me on a metro map stations where to go for sight seeing. i arrived early at the hotel 11oc and the let me check in early, and when leaving they let me keep my room until1.30. overall a great hotel with great staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for cleanliness, price and location. Staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: chilledtiff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as a site seeing/ exploring tour of Berlin. It was a great distance from the U-Bahn station which was just 10 mins walk away which then you could get a connection to anywhere in the city. The rooms were a decent size with a lovely desk and seating area. Bathroom was good, with a great power shower and nice big mirror, the hair-dryer could have been a bit better. Rooms and hotel were always clean and tidy. Wi-Fi was very expensive. Reception staff left a lot to be desired. They were quite distant and a little bit rude and very unhelpful. On the occasions that we asked for anything like to phone and see if there were any tickets left for a show they point blank refused. Overall a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daft-duck50
Reviews.Content: stayed at the park hotel for 5 nights at the end of august, got a great price{ 193 euro for the 4 nights} so was a bit worried about the hotel. i have to add to all the other great reviews about the hotel. the location is out of the city centre about 5 mins walk to the metro,( i got a 5 day visitor pass at the airport for 35 euro} so got great use of the metro and the buses. the room i was given was on the 5th floor facing the street(512), the room was very big for the price i paid,the bathroom was spotless clean bath/shower combo with great water pressure,bed was great, was very comfortable as were the pillows, my only complaint was the veniatian blinds on the windows were filthy and one was broken. i found all staff very courteous and helpful, did not use the restaurant at all as there was a price war between two Italian restaurants just down the road before you reach the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good service.”
Reviews.Author: WistaWio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property with my wife for two nights in May. We have found this hotel to be a great bargain. The check in was very pleasant. All personnel was extremely polite and helpful. The were eager to answer any questions and accommodate any needs of the guests. Front desk even provided us with AA batteries for our camera at night before we went out to a night club. The rooms are clean and spacious. the beds are quite comfortable with nice, soft linen and pillows. There are no safes in the room but all of your valuables can be stored at the front desk. You get to keep the key to your belongings. The only downside to the hotel is its location. The property is in Neukoln neighborhood, which is a bit out of they way. The locals stated that it is not the nicest or safest of Berlin neighborhoods, but during our stay we did not feel uncomfortable even for a second. The phenomenal public transport in Berlin operates around the clock and you can travel from the hotel to the Mitte in 15 - 45 minutes depending on the time of day or night:) Overall this hotel is a great find. For the price your really are getting a lot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible area and on a main busy road. Not good for a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Tajine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the price and the fact my flight got in very late and there was a good bus connection. The bus is very convenient and the hotel is around half an hour so it's handy if you need to be near the airport but close to town. The hotel is set on a very busy main road with nothing around. i didn't like the area at all. The hotel is nice with a big reception, restaurant and bar. The staff were friendly enough. The room was big with a slightly aging decor but nothing disagreeable. Bathroom was clean. The aircon didn't work and I found it very very hot in the room. I opened the window but the awful traffic noise outside was unbearable so I had toi shut the window and deal with the heat. I went to the bar and had a few drinks, it was fine, nothing spercial. I nread previous reviews about getting a free city day pass for the metro but they didn't offer me one. In short, if you are spending three or four days in Berlin this hotel is not a good idea. If ther ear etwo of you remember you will need daily metro passes with cost around £6 each. I checked out the next day and booked another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect bargain”
Reviews.Author: BGLIFE
Reviews.Content: For the money I had paid - 66 euro for 2 nights, I guess that was the best hotel I could get in Berlin. The service: Helpful and friendly, good command of English. I had a dinner at the restaurant where I asked the salad to be without any dressing. It was brought by other waitress and there was dressing. I did not complain, it was not so important to me, but the first one (that got the order) passing by my table saw it and asked me specially if there is dressing inside. As a compensation they brought me a free dessert by my choice. And it was done without any complaints from my side! The room: Large and clean. Nice design. Huge wardrobe suitable for suites. The amenities: Satellite TV and other standard amenities. The internet is not free, actually it is expensive. They have a safe paring lot, I'm not sure though if it is free or not. The food: The breakfast was not included (I had to pay additionally), so I cannot tell you how it is, but as I said I had a dinner at their restaurant and it was really tasty. The price was OK. The location: Really calm area. A big park is situated near and the air is really fresh. The center is far away, but I don't consider it as a problem because of the perfect Berlin's transportation. A common U-Bahn and S-Bahn station named Neukölln is 10 minutes away with bus. (The bus stop is in front of the hotel) And generally you can reach every point of the city from Neukölln with maximum one change. One of the biggest malls is close to the hotel, but I didn't visit it. As a resume, I think that the hotel is suitable for all purposes. Business travelers would like the calmness, tourist travelers would like the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good location, EXCELLENT price!”
Reviews.Author: thebanshee
Reviews.Content: Hi, we have recently returned from a fab weekend break to Berlin. We stayed in the Park Hotel Blub, the price was brilliant, really cheap. Granted it is outside the City centre BUT the city centre is HUGE! It's only a 2 minute walk to a bus stop (handy for the airport) and a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro station.. The hotel itself was great, my partner and i had a large corner room, so it was light and airy, the facilities were great (no kettle unfortunately) and the bathroom was super, great hot shower, toiletries and towels. Our friends had an inside room, facing the inside of the hotel foyer/restaurant so they didn't have any windos in their bathroom but they were very happy with their room. The beds were comfortable and we were very happy with the accommodation. Breakfast was lovely, included in our rates, a buffet breakfast with hot bacon and sausages etc etc, the typical German breakfast basically. Staff were brilliant, very nice, very helpful. We enjoyed relaxing in the lounge area and in the bar. The reception staff stored our luggage when we checked out so that we could spend a few more hours in the CIty, this was extremely handy as when we returned we picked it up and walked the 2 minutes to the bus stop where we caught the airport bus...! We all agreed that we would return to this hotel, so would obviously reccommend it to friends and fellow travellers....

Reviews.Title: “HUGE room, ok location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: zoobus
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Blub so it was something like 20 or 30 euros a night each, which was incredibly cheap considering the size of the room. It was bigger than my house! And very clean and comfortable. There was even a balcony, but it was too cold to really make the most of it. Very polite service, everyone seemed to speak English. The location is about 8 minutes walk from the tube station (it seems like a long time when there's a freezing wind blowing!), but it's not too far really. And the trains are so reliable and frequent I think it is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality value”
Reviews.Author: Alexx84
Reviews.Content: As always I was looking for a hotel with good price/quality, close to city center or metro station, and of course with good reviews from previous visitors. 5 mins from Grenzalle station, with one change twenty minutes to anywhere in central Berlin. Parking for 7€ extra (garage) or 5€ (open air). We ordered two twins, but got one twin and one double, despite the hotel looked half-empty (rather less), but I guess this could be fixed by front desk (we did not asked as we only was 3 people instead of planned 4). Twin room was way bigger then the double. We did not take the breakfast as it was way expensive (some 12€), and prices in the city was way lower. There is very cheap but good Argentinian restaurant some 50 metres from Grenzalle metro towards the hotel, where we ate pizza for 2,2€! with some free apetizer... unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice hotel, but far from Berlin city center”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBackpacker
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but it was far from the airport and the city center. It took me 20 minutes and 2 metros to get to the city center. If you want to do the tourist thing in Berlin, I would recommend finding a hotel closer to the center of town, as you will be spending most of your time in the city. The staff is very friendly and the price is right. If you are on a budget, don't mind the metros, and want a nice place to stay, this would be perfect for you. Next time I go to Berlin, I will find a hotel closer to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “berlin getaway”
Reviews.Author: ashface
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the park hotel blub for 5 nights in early feb for the berlin film festival. The hotel was really easy to get to from schonfeld airport , there was only one change on the s/u bahn trains.Grenazalle was the nearest stop,which was 5 mins walk away! It was easy enough to get all round the city but it was a bit stressful thinking about getting back late at night .All the facilities were clean and the room was cleaned daily and the bar was open till the early hours of the morning. breakfast was 12 euros each per day ,as we did not book it with the room. Overall it was a good location , friendly staff and comfortable rooms especially for the price of £35 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ACG580
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price. The rooms are clean and modern. The furnishings are a little sparse but not bad. The biggest downside to this hotel is the location. It is located near a U Bahn stop but in bad weather dragging luggage all of a sudden it does not seem so close. Once you reach the U it is about a 30 minute ride to get in town. For the same price or slighly more it is possible you can find the same caliber lodging closer in. If you need somewhere to stay in that area of Berlin I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ASwanners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Blub for 5 days. It is somewhat off the beaten track in regards to being at the centre of Berlin but it was easily reached by taxi from the airport. We found no problems using public transport and if anything enjoyed ourselves more as we actually saw lots more of Berlin then if everything was on our doorstep. Public transport was amazingly efficient and very reasonably priced and easy to use. The hotel room was pristine and surpassed our expectations, we had only paid about £30 per night! It was so good that we kept thinking they were going to say that we'd underpaid and try and charge us more, but they didn't - I would highly recommend having a look online for cheap rooms like we did, we saved about £60 a night. The food was amazing, little bit pricey as it was a la carte but worth it if you want a treat. The staff were all very helpful and always asked about our day. the bar area and restaurant were always spotless. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is interested in the historical and cultural aspects of Berlin as it was far enough away from the city centre to be cheap but near enough to Grenzalle underground to be accessible to pretty much eveything. One last thing when in Berlin you MUST try Berliner Weissbier mit Schuss, it's pale wheat beer with a shot of either raspberry or something green that the barlady didn't know the english for! It is absolutely amazing, not a big beer fan but have been scouring shops for it in england, nothing comes close.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if attending conference / exhibition at Estrel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timbo46
Reviews.Content: At 75 euro per night including a very good breakfast the Park Hotel Blub is a good option for anyone attending a conference or exhibition at the Estrel Hotel & Convention centre, where accomodation is more than twice as much. The hotel itself is clean, rooms are good size although not all have air con. Breakfast very good. There's a bus stop right outside which is only 5 stops away from the Estrel with only a short walk at the other end, costs only 1 euro 30. It's also very close to Schoenefeld airport, only 10 / 15mins away, about 20 euro in taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after 2 nights at Residence Chatillon in Paris, which was a typical Parisian dump disguised as a hotel. So my positive view about Park Hotel Blub Berlin may have been enhanced by an immediate past negative experience. The hotel is on a bus route directly to and from Berlin Schoenefeld (if I recall correctly, it is route 171). The U Bahn station is about 5 minutes walk away. If you are going to catch a train anywhere, it is very convenient. The staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient. The hotel reception was not fancy, but functional and simple. The room was clean. The bathroom was very nice and clean also. There aren't too many restaurants around the area, but there are a few small places for food. The area around the hotel is not the best part of Berlin. It looks a bit run down, but it did not appear to be unsafe. WiFi access is not free. It costs EUR 15 per day. The connection speed was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Quarrier
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel and I would stay there again...if it was closer to the centre. The room was big, beds were comfortable, bathroom was modern and clean. Good business hotel, especially for the price. It had a carpark, so I would possibly stay there if using Berlin as a base for exploring that area of Germany. However, the location is too far out of the centre of Berlin. It is only a 5min walk to the underground station and a few stops to the centre (20mins), but it took us an hour to reach particular locations within the city. Berlin is a big city and it can take a while (despite excellent and efficient public transport) to reach places in the east and west without having the extra 20 minute journey into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice for the price but slighly off the path”
Reviews.Author: rathnam
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin with my wife and some friends in Aug 2007 and stayed for 4 nights. To start with, this hotel is quite close to the Schonefeld airport - There is a direct bus to the hotel or we can take a train and then a bus. For anyone coming into Berlin by train this hotel is quite a distance from the main station (around 1.5 hours). The hotel is a good 7-10 mins walk from the underground metro station but its on the main road and it seemed a decent enough place so we were not worried to come in late at night. There are good cafes near the underground station which was convenient for breakfast. We arrived quite early in the morning but we were offered the room immediately even though the check in time was around 12. The staff were quite friendly and ready to answer any questions (in english). Our room was very very nice for the price we paid - with AC/Minibar/TV/big bath. But note that our friends who booked after us had a room with no Air conditioning and it was quite uncomfortable for them. I think the newer blocks have A/C and they allot this first so booking early might ensure this. Overall our experience was quite good... but do ensure you get a room with A/C during summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel - but check a/c or room location if light sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: RWRB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are on a 4 month "flash packing" trip around Europe and the Americas and we were looking for good budget accomodation Modern hotel is a 5min walk from U-bahn station (Grenzalle, U7) and an awesome location for Schonefeld or Templehof Airports. It is about 20 - 30 mins to central berlin locations with 1 / 2 changes (usually very easy). Room was big (with very comfortable beds), staff friendly, spoke great english, wi-fi available in lounge (was free although ads in hotel suggested it had to be paid for). Also a central safe with own key. Only downside was the lack of a/c, which meant had to sleep with windows open onto a reasonably busy main road (fine for us as we are heavy sleepers). But at £26 per night through expedia, we can't really complain! Note, hotel breakfast is expensive, just pop up the road to the italian! Also restaurants nearby, inlcuding the greek all fine if you don't facny / need a trip to central Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Very basic 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dart22
Reviews.Content: There are very few negative things you can say about this hotel. But to start off the review, trip advisor gives this hotel a 4 rating. That puts this hotel on a level with some of the best hotels money can buy you. And that is complete fiction. The hotel is rated a three star superior, but it is just about a three star. The beds are small and not the most comfortable for a start. The location is about 15 minutes or so from the centre of berlin by U-Bahn (subway). However the location shouldn't put you off because German trains are unbelievably efficient, reliable and represent good value. The location the hotel is situated in seems nice enough too, no problems. People have given this hotel 5 star ratings, but it only deserves two or three at best (I'm feeling generous today). It is very basic. Don't expect any luxury. We went to Berlin in early June. It was the weekend and Berlin was full of tourists but this hotel was empty. There was only about two other people in the restaurant one night. If you're looking for basic, decent, affordable accommodation in a decent area for sightseeing of Berlin, for a brief stay, then this is the hotel for you. Check out traveller photos of this hotel because the official pictures of this hotel, inside and outside, make it look and seem nicer than it actually is. We got the hotel for about 25 to 30€ pppn. This of course represents very good value for money. You get what you pay for. Don't pay much more for the hotel, it's worth the price we payed for it, overall quite satisfied with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to All”
Reviews.Author: TONIreland
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had an amazing stay at this hotel, it was a few minute walk from the grenzallie U-bahn, there is also two shops right beside the hotel that sell food and drink, plus a few restarants along the same road. the rooms where spotless and where cleaned everyday, the fact there was no air conditioning was not a problem when we stayed in june, we spent most of our day sightseeing. I read a few bad reviews on trip advisor about this hotel but this hotel was nothing like it was described. It was excellent. It was a great place to stay for our 7 day stay in berlin, it was only a 10 minute train journey from all the major sites. the U-bahn is so easy to use, you will have no problem getting about. Berlin is an amazing city and this is a great place to stay A++++

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Travelfanman
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend here for four nights in May. We had flown into Schonefeld, so this hotel was easily accessible by bus or the S/U-Bahn, even late at night. Our room was two single beds next to one another, with a bath and shower ensuite. The room was immaculately clean and was quite spacious. All the hotel staff we spoke to spoke English, and were very helpful. Breakfast was 12 Euro per person if its not included, we didn't have breakfast here and we didn't see the size of the portions, however there is a small cafe opposite Grenzallee U-Bahn station (the nearest station) that sells a huge continental type breakfast for 4 Euro. This is ideal as you'd be going that way if you're going anywhere by U/S-Bahn. As an aside there is a restaurant between the hotel and Grenzallee station, which has a large pizza/steaks etc sign outside (you couldn't miss it), which does food amazingly cheap (ie. 1.5 Euro for soup starter, 4 Euro for a pasta main course). The food was great here, mind out for the 3.50 Euro coke there though. In summary, the hotel was excellent, the location was good (although on a map it looks way out of the city centre it is a five minute walk to Grenzallee U-bahn station which connects you with the city centre), but the best bit was the price. It only cost us £120 in total, which for the standard of hotel I thought was amazing. I would definately stay here if I went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, too far from Berlin City”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent apart from the distance from Berlin. I booked a standard single room for £27 per night through Expedia. This included breakfast which was of excellent quality with a wide variety of food to choose from. The room itself was a fair size and was clean and modern, with a nice sized television. Wi-fi in the lobby is free of charge - a big big bonus for me as too often I get ripped off with high fees. The only snag with the Blub it is its distance from Berlin Centre. It took us at least 25 minutes on the underground and involves two to three changes, depending on where in Berlin you need to be. But, on the whole, taking in to account price and quality, if you don't mind the distance to Berlin or prefer to stay in the suburbs, I couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Twistedillustrator
Reviews.Content: Room okay, but when it says a standard double room, it means two single beds pushed together with separate duvets! Not what you expect when you pay for something that says Standard double room! Would not recommend this hotel for the reasons below: We had an item stolen from our hotel room. When we complained to staff about this, it was not taken seriously. We then couldn't let the maid in to do any further cleaning during our stay. Generally felt unconfortable with situation, and our feelings not taken into account seriously enough by manager of hotel (a couple of staff were quite nice and friendly there though). Other receptionists were not very cheerful or friendly either. Hotel literally in the middle of nowhere - it was at least 20 minutes walk to nearest station, in an isolated and dark area at night - hardly any shops or restaurants nearby! Would not recommend this hotel as found it unacceptable and not very good at customer serivce.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Czech_traveller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly for the location, driving from the East towards Berlin you can get here direct from the highway and then you are just 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro. Hotel is very modern, rooms basic but clean and tidy, reception was very helpful. Great choice of hot and cold food for breakfast even when we turned up at 10.30 one morning. Would recommend it, especially to Budget travellers, we paid only 75 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Not centrally located but an excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: missjos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about four blocks from the metro. The rooms are small but clean. And the price was $40 euros a night. Definitly no more than two people per room. Parking was $6 euros a day, and breakfast was $7 euros with a coupon. The rooms do not have airconditioning so I wouldn't recommend staying here in the middle of summer. The bathrooms are a fairly good size but the showers are small, which is weird since there was definitely room to make a larger shower. This hotel is closer to Schonefield and Templehof Airports. The autobahn is about five blocks from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A three stars superior? I'd say... at least four stars!”
Reviews.Author: james84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Berlin for holiday from 6 to 12 August. We found the hotel on the internet in April and decided to book at once, as the price was very reasonable. The Park Hotel Blub is in the peripherical area of Neukoelln, south Berlin, but it's very easy to reach both from Schoenefeld Airport (just one bus that takes you directly in front of it) and the center, as U-Bahn and S-Bahn are just five minutes walk away. On the arrival, a very nice and pleasant staff checked us in few minutes. As our room would have been ready at 4pm, we took a walk in the center of Berlin and went back to the hotel later in the evening. In the meantime, our bags were placed in a private room and we were given a receipt in order to take them back. The room, a double one with an extra bed and private facilities, was placed in the dependance in front of the main entrance. It was spotlessly clean and had a mini bar, a kitchenette, satellite TV, and there were a hair dresser and clean towels in the bathroom (these last were replaced with clean ones every day). Every day we came back late in the evening, and we always found a very helpful and kind staff. Definitely a place to stay in Berlin, as the price is reasonable (though we did not have breakfast there, as we would pay a lot more) and the quality is very high! I hope one day I will be able to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: linzmason
Reviews.Content: Initially, we were excited to stay in a 4* hotel, but when we arrived we quickly found out there was NO air conditioning in this hotel. The rooms were very nice and spacious, but sweltering in the middle of July. Our room was on the ground floor and when we opened the curtains we were literally 3 feet away from the atrium restaurant. Basically we could hear people's conversations while they were eating breakfast and we couldn't shut the windows because it was so hot. There was VERY little air flow and the fact that anyone could peek in at anytime from the restaurant was very disturbing. This hotel is no where near city center but is about a 5 minute walk to the nearest tube stop. The staff is very friendly, speaks great English and is willing to help. We were glad to pay the rate we did, but I think we could've found better accomodation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: dby401
Reviews.Content: Hotel blub is clean, modern looking and nicely appointed on the inside and out. Rooms were huge, with very comfortable beds which had duvets. Two windows in the room, nice shower, nice drapes. Location is a little out from the centre of the city, but its about a 3 minute walk to the Grenzallee U-Bahn station, and takes about 10 minutes to get to Alexanderplatz by U-Bahn. Paid about 40 euros a night with taxes included booked on Expedia, and was one of the better hotels I've stayed in. I would say it is a 3.5 star hotel compared to others I've seen. Ideal hotel for those visiting Berlin who don't have to be very close to the main sights, and especially those on a budget, as I believe this hotel worked out to be cheaper than staying in a hostel. The only gripe I had was that some of the receptionists seemed slightly surly but then again so are most Berliners. What an excellent deal on a great hotel. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: borris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good find, for the price we paid, you couldn't really ask for more! The room was a bit basic, but it was probably becasue we opted for standard rather than the more expensive option as we were on a budget. The room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is not in central Berlin , but Grenzallee U-Bahn, and a bus stop are about a 5-10 walk away and goes to many of the busier areas. We didn't get to try the pool complex near by as they were renovating it...you can try the sauna though, but be aware that it is mixed and naked!?! I would stay here again as I am not too fussy about being in the centre, the public transport is so cheap that it was no hassle at all! If you want to stay in central Berlin, this probably is not the right hotel for you, but of you want somewhere that is cheap and cheerful and a very nice hotel then I would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: The primary reason we picked this hotel was for the price, and it was very good value indeed for the money. The hotel is situated 5 mins walk from the Grenzallee U-Bahn stop, which gives easy access to central Berlin. The hotel room was basic, but spotlessly clean. The beds were comfy and we were not kept awake by noise. The staff on reception were very polite and friendly (and spoke English, thankfully!) There's no denying that the hotel is not in a central area, or even a very busy area - but if price is the overriding concern and you intend to make full use of the U-Bahn then you will not go far wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: mareclar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August and were also put in the apartment block across from the hotel. The room was enormous for a hotel, the beds were wonderfully comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean (and everything was white!). Unfortunately, the breakfast was not included and we had to pay 6 Euros a day for parking. Although another user claimed that you need a car to get around Berlin if you stay at this hotel, I disagree. The Grenzallee U-Bahn stop was only a five minute walk from the hotel, and this went directly into the city. The U-Bahn runs frequently through this stop. I will definetly stay here again if I return to Berlin!
